title: Ticket #7201: Advertise GPUs*Usage for startd/slots
description:
While a monitored GPU device is assigned to a slot, we compute GPUs*Usage for that device and advertise it in the slot's job ad. We have the information to compute GPUs*Usage for the device since the last time the startd restarted; this information is not currently advertised anywhere, but might be useful. (Because of #7176, the attributes can't be name GPUs*Usage, but UptimeGPUs*Usage should be fine.)

Update the documentation that mentions Uptime* and only being available via a -direct query.
remarks:
This is in the critical path for what we want for GPU scheduling, so bumping up to priority 3.

2019-Aug-28 13:17:23 by tannenba:
Maybe call it GpuAvgUsage ? Because it is currently an average, unlike all the others like CpuUsage which are a peak...

2019-Aug-28 13:19:13 by tlmiller:
The plan, for now, is to (continue to) advertise GPUsUsage as the average value, hopefully changing the name to GPUsAverageUsage to make it clear that it's a different kind of Usage than the others. (Hopefully because it's not clear what changes we can make without writing some special-case code given the prevalence of magic regexes.)

2019-Aug-28 13:21:18 by tlmiller:
OK, that's actually two separate topics:

  • Changing the name of job ad attribute to GPUsAverageUsage.
  • Adding an attribute, UptimeGPUsAverageUsage, which we can call whatever we want, since nobody (particularly, the shadow) cares.

2019-Sep-05 17:54:10 by tlmiller:
Added UptimeGPUsAverageUsage.

(Changing the name of the job-ad attribute isn't simple because the Usage suffix is magic. A bunch of places in the code need to know to look for AverageUsage as well. I'll find all of them eventually.)
